title: Have you taken online classes? What was it like?

korean: 코로나 때문에 온라인 수업을 처음 경험해봤어요.
처음에는 되게 신기하고 편할 거라고 생각했거든요.
집에서 편하게 수업 들을 수 있으니까요.
실제로 출퇴근 시간 아끼는 건 정말 좋았어요.
아침에 여유롭게 일어나서 커피 마시면서 수업 듣고.
침대가 바로 옆에 있으니까 자꾸 눕고 싶고.
강사님이 화면 너머에 계시니까 긴장감도 덜하고.
가끔은 카메라 끄고 멍 때리기도 했어요, 솔직히.
그래도 녹화본을 다시 볼 수 있는 건 엄청 유용했어요.
못 알아들은 부분이나 중요한 내용을 복습할 수 있어서.
전반적으로는 나쁘지 않았지만 오프라인이 더 좋긴 해요.
english: I first experienced online classes because of COVID.
At first, I thought it would be really cool and convenient, you know.
Because I could take classes comfortably from home.
Saving commute time was definitely great.
I could wake up leisurely in the morning and listen to classes while drinking coffee.
But concentrating was way harder than I expected.
With my bed right next to me, I kept wanting to lie down.
With the instructor on the other side of the screen, there was less tension too.
Sometimes I turned off my camera and just zoned out, honestly.
But being able to watch the recordings again was super useful.
I could review parts I didn't understand or important content.
Overall it wasn't bad, but I still prefer offline classes.
